useCase.name: Active Tracking
useCase.description: A UAV actively tracks a victim.

preconditions.precondition: UAV is within near vision-range of the victim
UAV has actively tagged the victim

successEndConditions.condition: The UAV remains within near vision-range of the victim and streams video imagery to Emergency Responders

failureEndConditions.condition: UAV fails to actively track the victim

useCase.trigger: The UAV is assigned or assumes the task of tracking a person

mainSequence.step: The UAV positions itself in tracking_position, i.e., in the near vicinity of the victim but not directly overhead.
The UAV uses image capture and analysis to continually tag the victim in the image stream.
Based on the UAV's position (pitch, roll, yaw), the onboard tracker continually calculates the relative position of the victim with respect to the UAV.

The onboard tracker generates appropriate velocity vectors to fly towards the victim, without flying directly over the victim and maintaining victim_separation_distance and always flying at an altitude greater than minimum_altitude.
The velocity vector is sent to the UAV's autopilot and executed to enable the UAV to track the victim.
Steps 2-5 are repeated until the UAV receives a stop_tracking command.

esteps.description: The UAV loses track of the victim
esteps.step: The UAV attempts to re-tag the victim by changing altitude and performing a localized search.
